unit: Introducing yourself and welcoming service users
intro: Your task is to introduce yourself to a new resident, Mrs Jameson, who has recently moved in and is feeling confused about the names of the staff. Use empathetic and clear communication to help her feel comfortable and supported.
description_html:
In this scenario, you will practice introducing yourself to a new resident who has recently moved into the care home. Mrs Jameson is feeling confused about staff names and needs clear, empathetic communication to help her settle in.

Learning objectives:

  • Introduce yourself clearly and professionally
  • Ask about preferred names and record them
  • Provide reassurance to anxious residents
  • Use name badges effectively

resident.name: Mrs Jameson
goals: learn the names of carers on duty
must_disclose: finding it hard to remember staff names
is quiet and not very chatty
refusals: will not remember all staff immediately
will not engage in long chatty conversations

actions.title: Show name badge
actions.prompt: You point to your name badge to help Mrs Jameson see your name clearly.
